Files | Data Structures | Macros | Typedefs | Functions
TDA2xx SBL Utilities

Files

file  sbl_utils_tda2xx.h
 This file contains the SBL Utility layer specific to TDA2xx SOC family. This also contains some related macros, structures and enums.
 

Data Structures

struct  sblutilsDelayConfig
 This structure defines the delay configuration for IO Delay Config Registers: CFG_X_IN, CFG_X_OUT and CFG_X_OEN. More...
 
struct  sblutilsPadDelayConfig
 This structure defines the delay configuration associated with a particular pad as given by PCT (Pad Configuration Tool). More...
 
struct  sblutilsDelayConfigRegValue
 This structure is used to store the calculated delay values to be configured in CFG_X_IN, CFG_X_OUT and CFG_X_OEN Registers. More...
 

Macros

#define CONFIG_REG_0   (uint32_t) (0x0000000CU)
 
#define CONFIG_REG_1   (uint32_t) (0x00000010U)
 
#define CONFIG_REG_2   (uint32_t) (0x00000014U)

#define CONFIG_REG_8   (uint32_t) (0x0000002CU)

#define CONFIG_REG_0_CALIBRATION_START_SHIFT   (0U)
 
#define CONFIG_REG_0_ROM_READ_MASK   (0x00000002U)
 
#define CONFIG_REG_0_ROM_READ_SHIFT   (1U)
 
#define CONFIG_REG_2_REFCLK_PERIOD_MASK   (0x0000FFFFU)
 
#define CONFIG_REG_2_REFCLK_PERIOD_SHIFT   (0U)
 
#define CONFIG_REG_3_COARSE_REF_COUNT_MASK   (0x0000FFFFU)
 
#define CONFIG_REG_3_COARSE_REF_COUNT_SHIFT   (0U)
 
#define CONFIG_REG_3_COARSE_DELAY_COUNT_MASK   (0xFFFF0000U)
 
#define CONFIG_REG_3_COARSE_DELAY_COUNT_SHIFT   (16U)
 
#define CONFIG_REG_4_FINE_REF_COUNT_MASK   (0x0000FFFFU)
 
#define CONFIG_REG_4_FINE_REF_COUNT_SHIFT   (0U)
 
#define CONFIG_REG_4_FINE_DELAY_COUNT_MASK   (0xFFFF0000U)
 
#define CONFIG_REG_4_FINE_DELAY_COUNT_SHIFT   (16U)
 
#define CTRL_CORE_SMA_SW_0_ISOIN_MASK   (0x00000004U)
 
#define CTRL_CORE_SMA_SW_0_ISOIN_SHIFT   (2U)

#define CONFIG_REG_8_UNLOCK_GLOBAL_LOCK   (0x0000AAAAU)

Typedefs

typedef struct sblutilsDelayConfig sblutilsDelayConfig_t
 This structure defines the delay configuration for IO Delay Config Registers: CFG_X_IN, CFG_X_OUT and CFG_X_OEN.
 
typedef struct sblutilsPadDelayConfig sblutilsPadDelayConfig_t
 This structure defines the delay configuration associated with a particular pad as given by PCT (Pad Configuration Tool).
 
typedef struct sblutilsDelayConfigRegValue sblutilsDelayConfigRegValue_t
 This structure is used to store the calculated delay values to be configured in CFG_X_IN, CFG_X_OUT and CFG_X_OEN Registers.
 

Functions

void SBLUtilsScaleIODelay (uint32_t bootMode)
 This function implements IODelay Recalibration. IODelay re-calibration is required due to change in AVS0 voltage, otherwise there is some IO timing error versus datasheet. More...
 
void SBLUtilsWDTimerBegin (void)
 This function get called in beginning of SBL. It refreshes the WDT to 3 mins, configures the delay event to 2 mins & registers the ISR handler. More...
 
void SBLUtilsWDTimerIsr (void *ptr)
 This function is delay event ISR. It refreshes the WDT to 3 mins & sets the delay to 2 mins. More...
 
void SBLUtilsWDTimerEnd (void)
 This function get called at the end of boot process. It un-registers the delay event ISR & disables the interrupt. It refreshes the WDT overflow value to 3 mins. Application has to take care of WDT. More...
 
int32_t SBLUtilsConfigStaticDependency (void)
 Function to configure the static dependencies from master clock domains to slave clock domains. More...
 
sblutilsPadDelayConfig_t * SBLUtilsGetPadDelayConfigStruct (uint32_t *padArraySize, uint32_t bootMode)
 This function returns the address of the pad config object and size of it to be used for a SOC. More...
 
sblutilsDelayConfigRegValue_t * SBLUtilsGetDelayConfigRegValStruct (sblutilsPadDelayConfig_t padDelayConfig[], uint32_t padArraySize)
 This function calculates the config value based on the Virtual and Manual mode delay values using the PCT and updates in same Object. More...
 
void SBLUtilsConfigPadMux (sblutilsPadDelayConfig_t padDelayConfig[], sblutilsDelayConfigRegValue_t padDelayRegValue[], uint32_t padArraySize)
 This function configures the SoC PAD Mux along with Virtual and Manual mode delays. padDelayRegValue object should be updated with config values using the SBLUtilsGetDelayConfigRegValStruct API before calling this function. More...

Function Documentation

void SBLUtilsConfigPadMux ( sblutilsPadDelayConfig_t  padDelayConfig[],
sblutilsDelayConfigRegValue_t  padDelayRegValue[],
uint32_t  padArraySize 
)

This function configures the SoC PAD Mux along with Virtual and Manual mode delays. padDelayRegValue object should be updated with config values using the SBLUtilsGetDelayConfigRegValStruct API before calling this function.

Parameters
padDelayConfigPad config object array
padDelayRegValuecalculated delau config value object array
padArraySizeNumber of elements in pad config Object
Returns
None
int32_t SBLUtilsConfigStaticDependency ( void  )

Function to configure the static dependencies from master clock domains to slave clock domains.

Returns
Status of the API. This function configures the static dependencies from master clock domains to slave clock domains.
status STW_SOK: Pass STW_EFAIL: Failure
sblutilsDelayConfigRegValue_t* SBLUtilsGetDelayConfigRegValStruct ( sblutilsPadDelayConfig_t  padDelayConfig[],
uint32_t  padArraySize 
)

This function calculates the config value based on the Virtual and Manual mode delay values using the PCT and updates in same Object.

Parameters
padDelayConfigPad config object array
padArraySizeNumber of elements in pad config Object
Returns
pointer to object sblutilsDelayConfigRegValue_t filled with the calculated delay config values to be programmed.
sblutilsPadDelayConfig_t* SBLUtilsGetPadDelayConfigStruct ( uint32_t *  padArraySize,
uint32_t  bootMode 
)

This function returns the address of the pad config object and size of it to be used for a SOC.

Parameters
padArraySizePointer to return size of pad config Object
bootModeBoot Mode with which SBL is built
Returns
Pointer to pad config object
void SBLUtilsScaleIODelay ( uint32_t  bootMode)

This function implements IODelay Recalibration. IODelay re-calibration is required due to change in AVS0 voltage, otherwise there is some IO timing error versus datasheet.

Parameters
bootModeBoot Mode with which SBL has been built.
Returns
None.
void SBLUtilsWDTimerBegin ( void  )

This function get called in beginning of SBL. It refreshes the WDT to 3 mins, configures the delay event to 2 mins & registers the ISR handler.

Returns
None.
void SBLUtilsWDTimerEnd ( void  )

This function get called at the end of boot process. It un-registers the delay event ISR & disables the interrupt. It refreshes the WDT overflow value to 3 mins. Application has to take care of WDT.

Returns
None.
void SBLUtilsWDTimerIsr ( void *  ptr)

This function is delay event ISR. It refreshes the WDT to 3 mins & sets the delay to 2 mins.

Parameters
ptrPointer to ISR.
Returns
None.
